data.title: Screen settings in Settings\Engine.json window section do not apply to the built program.
data.body:
The settings of window section in the Settings\Engine.json, such as resizable, width, and height, do not apply to the built program. The built program is still the original size and not resizable. 

However, when I tried to debug in Visual Studio 2015 Community, the window was in correct width/height, and resizable.

data.title: [Wiki] Broken platform images on build page
data.body:
@christoffersch  Great job converting all the image links to use local versions of the image files üëç  

It looks like the platform pngs have issues on the editor build page, they won't display in windows either when cloned from the repo

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Building-Atomic---The-Quick-and-Easy-Way

Can we switch up to use the same logos as on the downloads here? http://atomicgameengine.com/#download-the-atomic-editor  

Can use the same sizing as currently on the wiki page, though definitely want the Windows 10 logo instead :)  Thanks!

data.title: Update AUTHORS.md
Updating submodule commit
Add Time to script bindings
data.body: Adds Time to the script bindings.

data.title: [Examples] Move example info into AtomicExamples repo
data.body: The examples browser pulls examples from a json file in the engine repo, moving it to AtomicExamples will avoid unnecessary PR's like this one: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1229

data.title: Added Racer2D
Fix WebGL CI issue
[C#] Relative file warning on generated solutions
data.body:
Generated solutions have a warning regarding absolute files, changing to absolute, I am sure would fix this, though isn't really an option as introduces solution being tied to local box

```..\Resources\Scripts\Clouds.cs' could not be added to the project. '..\Resources\Scripts\Clouds.cs' is not an absolute path```

data.title: Investigate asset case sensitivity
data.body:
There was an issue where a texture didn't load from a material file due to case, assets should most likely be case insensitive  

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicExamples/pull/96

Investigate if this is also an issue on Windows or solely case sensitive file systems.

data.title: [Linux] --with-docs fail on some systems with nodejs
data.body:
On some systems the --with-docs switch will fail, depending on if nodejs and/or node is installed. The --with-docs appears to be calling node at times, not nodejs, as determined in Build/Linux/node/node.
By example :
@benwolf : after linking nodejs to node with "ln -s /usr/bin/nodejs /usr/bin/node" the --with-docs works on mint
This wouldn't work for me, since I have nodejs installed in my system, and node in the emscripten area, both are in my path.

data.title: Missing textures in cs example
data.body:
Creating and running  project based on Basic3D and choosing **js** for scripting shows a spinning treasure chest with proper textures . Log output shows the following:  

[Wed Nov 30 22:58:40 2016] INFO: Loading scene from Scenes/Scene.scene
[Wed Nov 30 22:58:40 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource b00f01294b1cc469d4db9f862c9296b7.mdl
[Wed Nov 30 22:58:40 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Models/Materials/DefaultMaterial.material
[Wed Nov 30 22:58:40 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Techniques/Diff.xml
[Wed Nov 30 22:58:40 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Textures/chest.png
[Wed Nov 30 22:58:40 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Components/Spinner.js

Creating and running  project based on Basic3D and choosing **cs** for scripting shows a spinning treasure chest with proper missing textures . Log output shows the following:  

[Wed Nov 30 22:54:03 2016] INFO: Loading scene from Scenes/Scene.scene
[Wed Nov 30 22:54:03 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource 2788364e8ff6f81f4b566a9d58e3fb5b.mdl
[Wed Nov 30 22:54:03 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Models/Materials/DefaultMaterial.material
[Wed Nov 30 22:54:03 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Techniques/Diff.xml
[Wed Nov 30 22:54:03 2016] ERROR: Could not find resource Textures/Chest.png

Looks like a problem with case, the cs project is looking for Chest.png and not chest.png.

Looking into it further, will try to provide a PR asap

data.title: VS2017 fix for when VS2015 isn't installed
Adding WebGL player copy for CI editor build task
AtomicTool improvements
data.body:
General AtomicTool improvements:
-Support for project paths being specified either as the project directory or the full .atomic file path
-Support for specifying log level with -loglevel argument

Project command specifically
-Fixed project<path> cache -clean reporting an error when the cache directory doesn't yet exist

data.title: Typescript improvements for integration with vscode
data.body:
There needs to be some improvements to the TypeScript integration to make working with vscode a little easier
* The ```allowNonTsExtensions``` setting is not compatible with the command line tsc, so need to either determine if this is no longer needed for the in-editor compiler, and don't emit this when generating an external ```tsconfig.json```
* when generating the ```tsconfig.json```, don't specifically use the ```files``` block.  Instead, use the ```include``` block.  When consuming the ```tsconfig``` in the editor, ignore that block and re-generate the ```files``` block.  This will keep from needing to manually add files to the tsconfig in vscode.
* possibly give the option to build out a tasks.json that will allow the TypeScript compilation step from vscode
* relook at the ```typings``` folder.  Maybe move ```ambient``` up right below the ```typings``` level.

data.title: Fixing crash with animation preview
data.body:
- Return handled when animation button is clicked as the button is deleted in the callback
- Updating widget remove child guard to ensure proper parent
- Guarding captured widget for multitouch

Closes #1216

data.title: [Editor] Crash when clicking model preview button
data.body:
This is on a release build on macOS (haven't verified if on windows yet)

1)  Create a JS project of RoboMan example
2) Select Models/Robo_01.fbx
3) Click Preview Animation button
4) Crash

```
Thread 0 Crashed:: CrBrowserMain  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread
0   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a6161a6 tb::TBWidget::InvokeEvent(tb::TBWidgetEvent&) + 214
1   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a616c21 tb::TBWidget::InvokePointerUp(int, int, tb::MODIFIER_KEYS, bool, int) + 449
2   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a4e6efd Atomic::UI::HandleMouseButtonUp(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 253
3   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a4db512 Atomic::EventHandlerImpl<Atomic::UI>::Invoke(Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 50
4   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a251b1f Atomic::Object::OnEvent(Atomic::Object*, Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 111
5   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a2527be Atomic::Object::SendEvent(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 1758
6   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a391db9 Atomic::Input::SetMouseButton(int, bool) + 265
7   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010a38ea60 Atomic::Input::HandleSDLEvent(void*) + 5392
```

data.title: Visual Studio 2017 and Visual Studio Mac support
data.body:
This PR adds support for Visual Studio 2017 and Visual Studio Mac

Closes #1188

data.title: Project template language and messaging #1190, #1118
data.body:
Made JavaScript the default language used for new projects and examples ( if they support it )
Examples will use the user selected default language, and otherwise the language precedence is JS, CS, TS.
Upon successfully installing a new project or example, the language used will become the default language.
The default language is saved in a preference.
When CSharp is not installed on a platform, the dialog box that comes up will now include instructions for Linux+monodevelop.
The Linux install operation will be directed to the Wiki page for building linux, which includes the install instructions for monodevelop.
Added API to get item strings out of a UISelectItemSource
Did not fix the closing of the New Project Dialog if it brings up the CSharp Download dialog, because both are modal, and you can not have 2 modal dialogs up at a time.

data.title: Disappearing sprite when resizing window
data.body:
I created a simple example to demonstrate the problem. If you keep resizing the window, eventually when you try to drag the sprite, it will disappear.

To reproduce, check out master and replace AEEditorApp.h and AEEditorApp.cpp with these files:

https://gist.github.com/keithjohnston/fd98d2c4a50ceb4f5fe1dcabeffccd98
https://gist.github.com/keithjohnston/bbc7512198438fabbcb7b929417d3ee3

Then resize the window, drag the sprite, keep resizing and eventually when you try to drag the sprite it disappears. When you release the mouse and it goes back to the original position - it reappears.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ty4tbRmRGCg

data.title: [macOS] Startup error when running binary app bundle: Failed to add resource path 'CoreData'
data.body:
- Download
- Execute
- Got error: `Failed to add resource path 'CoreData', check the documentation on how to set the 'resource prefix path'`

Can't find `how to set the 'resource prefix path'`

MacOS 10.12.1

data.title: Updating examples commit for usage of Atomic through add_subdirectory().
data.body: Since #1196 the AtomicExamples sub module has not been advanced to see AtomicGameEngine/AtomicExamples#95.

data.title: Close Player Output window when player quits #215
data.body: Added a checkbox that controls whether to close at stop (default is on), added a pref to make setting persistent, added a note to output UI about logs available in the main frame menu, auto close old window if you hit play again.

data.title: [UI] Add multitouch support from TurboBadger repo
data.body:
It seems TurboBadger has woken up from a slumber, this commit adds multi touch widget support.  

https://github.com/fruxo/turbobadger/commit/ee053688c1e2e11b4d19812aebf4a92dc84d4f84

We do have some hacks in place for multi touch, which could be backed out.  These were done some time ago and may be isolated from these changes, if so, as a follow up can file an issue to clean them out.
